name: jacquard

a type of cloth with a pattern woven (= made by crossing threads on a special frame) into it: Jacquard is very fashionable this season. The fabric is different to either of the previous jacquards. Some worked on the giant Jacquard looms, where thread flowed through hole-punched cards to weave intricate patterns.
More examplesFewer examplesThe jacquard knit reminds me of a colourful picnic cloth.His jacquard designs include a variety of patterns based on cultural themes and motifs.Even the most complex four-coloured jacquards are in reality only a basic slip pattern, where colours are changed every two rows.
